alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 20 at 7:50AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Bourbon, Cherokee and Crawford. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area earlier this morning. Between 2 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburg, Girard, Frontenac, Arma, Cherokee, Weir, Mulberry, Scammon, Mccune, Arcadia, West Mineral, Hepler, Chicopee, Franklin, Roseland, Ringo, Beulah, Polk, Lone Oak, Farlington, Englevale, Brazilton, Croweburg, Yale, Greenbush, Pawnee Station, Carona, Hiattville, Opolis, Skidmore, Stippville, Garland and Lawton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
